quotedTweet.rawContent:
TWENTY PEOPLE HAVE DMED ME ASKING IF Vanity article is DEFAMATION OF CHARACTER AGAINST @theadammcintyre 
JESUS. first of all remember. I’m still in process of getting my JD. But let’s look at the 4 characteristics needed
1st(false statement reporting to be a fact) vanity reaching out to Colleen’s lawyers and reporting on it as if it’s a quasi-fact could hold water as this. As well as Andrew indicating that Adam was lollygagging with the underwear and sending pictures of him in them? 
And the biggest part is Andrew’s claim that no sexual crime has been committed and how he brushed aside and acted as if Johnny didn’t receive nood photos of Trisha. He refused to EVEN NAME JOHNNY. 

2nd- publication and communication of that to a third person. 
This is tricky. Communication between vanity fair and Colleen’s lawyers would have to be subpoenaed in order to see what was said. 

3rd- fault amounting to negligence
Refusing to reach out to any of the victims and only reaching out to Colleen for comment is negligence of its own right. Also the lack of research presented can arguably be attributed to that as well an example would be refusing to acknowledge that grooming isn’t only sexual. And then hyper fixating on the single bad claim of blackface 

4th- damages and harm caused to party affected. 

Yes. Adam could easily prove that by his reputation and believability in the public sphere this has smeared his name 

Since this is written it’s considered a libel case at which could we prove that actual malice was proven here. 
The talking point of only reaching out to Colleen’s lawyers could be used here and only solid proof of that conversation combined with examples of text from vanity fairs article could be used to prove actual malice. ( which is the intent to damage someone’s reputation) I’ll post 4 examples below. 1( vf hyperfocusing on the black face allegation ) 2 ( painting Adam to be obsessed with Colleen ballinger ) 3 ( VF only reaching out to Colleen) 4. VF’s NEGLIGENCE  of being able to dictate that grooming isn’t always sexual 

Those are my thoughts just remember. I’m only a paralegal in law school. I still need to take the bar. This is NOT legal advice it’s just a legal analysis from a paralegal who is also in pursuit of passing the bar.
